dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleepy thick fatigue, the end of a red-eye flight. Most passengers still asleep, a few read, or stare blankly. In business class, A HUSBAND and WIFE, mid-30's. He's awa reading a document. She sleeps nestled against his should He's trim, sharp, good looking in an academic way. Even i sleep, she's beautiful. Wide-mouthed and honey-haired. The plane's aspect SHIFTS, the pilot's voice comes on in German. The man lifts his window shade, peers out at the first rays of sun touching the skyline of Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo of lights. Giant talons, the airplane's LANDING GEAR appears through cloud. Tires hit slick asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple. Dr. Martin Harris and Elizabeth Harris. WIDER German IMMIGRATION OFFICER glances up at MARTIN and LIZ. CHUNK! KA-CHUNK! Stamps both passports, swipes the bar codes over a scanner, hands them back. Martin slips his i a leather briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raining. A melee of travelers and vehicles. Liz beside hi Martin wheels a baggage cart through the crush. An ATTEND ushers them toward a waiting cab and DRIVER... a CRASH of THUNDER -- the rain suddenly triples in strength. A DELUGE. The taxi driver hustles Martin and Li towards his car. He shields his head with a newspaper, piling their bags into the trunk, cursing. Martin sets down his case, moves to help the driver...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TAXI CAB
dialogues.text: The DRIVER merges onto the autobahn. Liz yawns with jet-l studies Martin who stares out at the passing city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... You're gonna do great. You always do.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TAXI/HOTEL IMPERIAL, BERLIN
dialogues.text: Modern 'Deco Revival' hotel/conference center. A banner welcomes delegates to the World Biotechnology Forum. The Harris' taxi pulls up in the forecourt thick with red-eye travelers arriving for early morning check-in. Martin takes out his billfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do this. You check in. Liz pecks his cheek, gets out. Martin leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do we owe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz presses up to the crowded desk. A busy RECEPTIONIST takes Liz's booking slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eisenhower suite. Dr. and Mrs. Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELLHOP holds a large umbrella up to the rain, loads th Harris' bags onto his cart. Shuts the trunk, the taxi pul away. Heading for the entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Hotel Imperial. Have you stayed with us before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is our first visit to Berlin. We're -- -- he stops short, staring at their bags, stacked on the luggage cart. He turns, tracks the their taxi, already pulling out of the drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a stab of concern on Liz's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean the suite may not be available?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to check with the manager. Security inspections of the rooms are still being completed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we confirmed two months ago. Receptionist raises an apologetic hand as she attends to ringing phone. Liz sighs, glances back toward the entranc Suddenly curious as she sees...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE GLASS WALL
dialogues.text: . Martin standing in the open door of the next taxi in line. He speaks to the bellhop who nods, quickly pushing cart in through the doors, headed for Liz...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TAXI/BERLIN
dialogues.text: Martin getting in, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tegel airport. Arrivals. Quick. The driver pulls out into traffic. The rain still heavy. Martin stares out at the wet city. Eyes track as the shad columns of the Brandenburg Gate pass by. He lets himself relax a little, enjoying this moment of forced calm. He catches sight of the driver in the rear-view. Young, female, shortish hair. Tomboy cute. Smart eyes, older tha her years. Layers of clothing. GINA. She glances into the mirror, catches Martin watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone says how much it's changed. Berlin. Eyes connect, brief. Wipers flip-flap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .I wouldn't know. First time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, me too. I mean, I wouldn't know either. You're American? He looks back at her, inquisitive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the airport, it's always Americans in the morning... Asians at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin nods, pulls out his phone. Service dies as Gina downshifts, Doc Martins working the pedals, accelerates a from the large "Flughafen" (Airport) sign, down a cobbled road next to main route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you missed... He stops, smiles as he realizes she's navigated around a large construction back-up, saving them time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you do, I do what I do, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do, when you're not...? She laughs. He smiles, nods. Okay, dumb thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I didn't mean anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I know what you meant. Her eyes meet his in the mirror. She swings the taxi onto Wilhelmstrasse. Stops at a red light. Ahead, the Marshall Bridge over the River Spree.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT TURNS GREEN
dialogues.text: Gina moves the taxi mid-stream in the traffic heading ont the bridge. Martin checks his phone, he's got service. He starts to dial... Suddenly -- the cars in front of her start VEERING WILDLY DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS, just missing the boxed REFRIGERATOR tumbling off the truck in front of them. The box BURSTS open. Gina swerves to avoid it, CLIPS the corner... front tire BLOWS OUT... taxi skids crazily, HITS the CURB. Tires SHREDDING... shower of SPARKS. Taxi SLAMS ove the curb, THROUGH the rail. Plunges off the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangely serene. Intense vivid IMAGES... the playing car 'ACE TAXIS' logo on the dash... GINA'S EYES in the MIRROR Silent free-fall dive. Timeless. Dreamlike.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM--
dialogues.text: Martin's head SMACKS against the side window. Gina cushio by the airbags, which she wrestles back. WATER SPRAYS IN. Gina can't open her door. Steel steering-lock on the floo Grabs it, SMASHES the side window. Hauls herself out...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE RIVER
dialogues.text: . gasping. On the bridge above, people frantically flag down traffic... Gina turns, sees the Taxi, midstream, sinking. Martin still in back, unconscious. No time. Gina gulps air, dives. She reaches into the fron of the cab, grabs the steering lock, HAMMERS it against t passenger window, glances up: THE SURFACE, starts to recede as the taxi slips underneat sinking... Gina hammers at the glass again, it BREAKS. Grabs Martin' limp body, drags him up to the surface. A CROWD ON the bank. People wading out to help. Taking Martin from her, carrying him up onto dry land. LIGHTS, SIRENS... The POLICE arriving, pushing back the crowd. PARAMEDICS quickly laying Martin out on the concrete. Everyone's focus on the unconscious man. Gina eases back. melts away into the growing horde of on-lookers as the paramedics rip open Martin's shirt... feeding a tube down his throat. Pushing on his stomach. DEFIBRILLATOR paddles. WHINE as defibrillators charge. A PARAMEDIC lifts Martin's eyelid, shines a flashlight...

dialogues.speaker: FAINT HALO OF LIGHT
dialogues.text: in a dark fog. Distant voices -- SUDDEN SHIFT --.INTENSE FLASH OF MEMORY... UNIVERSITY LECTURE HALL. Youthful MARTIN speaking on the spotlit podium. Intense, energized. A college age LIZ in the audience. LAUGHTER of rapt students. Loud APPLAUSE. A jovial older COLLEAGUE eagerly shaking Martin's hand... SMASH BACK TO THE RIVER BANK... Paddles on Martin's chest. Paramedic calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Achtung! WHOMPF! The charge surges into Martin's body.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH OF WHITE LIGHT...
dialogues.text: a CONSERVATORY. Martin as a CHILD. Fascinated, delighted as his FATHER shows him the opening bud of a blossom. Butterflies' wings SHIMMER in sunlight... WHOMPF! SECOND ARCING CHARGE... Martin's chest heaves up. Slumps back down... SMASH CUT INTO MEMORY -- TWO BODIES MOVING... . Liz and Martin making love. Passionate, intertwined. WHOMPF! ANOTHER SURGE OF ELECTRICITY... Martin's chest rising up... SMASH CUT AGAIN -- LIZ... . half-dressed, hair ruffled and wet. Towelling it. Turning toward us. Smiles. Her lips moving... WHOMPF! A FOURTH PULSE... Martin's body slumping back. Sudden QUIET now, the world removed. Just his face. His eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They say your whole life flashes before you... but it's the little things... the details... the moments. Its like looking at a painting. Stand close, all you can see are the brush strokes. It's only when you step back that you get the whole picture... SLOWLY BECOMING...

dialogues.speaker: THE FILMY RED
dialogues.text: . of light seen from behind closed eyelids. Quiet... except for a distant sound. CRACKLING. Like falling rain. The sound growing. Close now. Filling our ears, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .a tiny pin-hole of light, TOO BRIGHT. GLIMPSES of a NURS as she tears the wrapping off a fresh drip sac...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .A man's voice... distant. German words. Small, faded image of a German DOCTOR, speaking with the nurse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .again, a pin-hole of consciousness. The Nurse, taking a private moment, speaking in German on her cell-phone. The Nurse looks over, straight at us, realization in her face she hurries from the room. We REVOLVE... finding... MARTIN HARRIS. Arms by his sides A few days beard. A sutured cut on his temple. His eyes fluttering, barely open... then closing. Clipboard beside the bed. An admission form. In German. Where Martin's name should be: "unbekannte maennliche Person", and the SUBTITLE becomes our MAIN TITLE... 'UNKNOWN WHITE MALE'...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN'S FACE
dialogues.text: Squeak of a door. Distant FOOTSTEPS. Quiet again. Just th distant PULSE of his heartbeat. His eyes... flick OPEN. MARTIN'S P.O.V. - HIS SURROUNDINGS... Vision BLURRED, BLINKING to focus. Scrubbed floor, white walls, Banks of drips and monitors, his possessions on a table near him...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Konnen Sie mich horen?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN'S EYES
dialogues.text: Daylight through a window. Sitting by the bed is a dark- haired man with a van Dyke beard. DR. FARGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wenn Sie mich horen konnen, blinken Sie zweimal. He watches as Martin's eyes tilt. Look directly at him. A sound. A dry croak... slowly forms itself into speech:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't... speak German...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat - accented) Are you English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . American... A beat. Farge signals the Nurse to come in. Speaks to him slowly and clearly in English:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Doctor Farge. You are in the Waldfriede Hospital. I'm the head neurologist here. You have been in an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me your name? Beat. Martin nods. Voice weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin... Harris. Doctor... Martin Harris... Farge exchanges a look with the nurse. To Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you staying? Is there anyone here, in Berlin, that we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin suddenly looks around, struggles to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife.. ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my wife? Liz...? Is she hurt? Where is she --?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Harris, it's all right. The taxi you were in went into the river. You were the only passenger. Your heart stopped for six minutes. It is Thursday, November 27th. For four days you have been in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanksgiving... but my wife... she's in Berlin with me. Where is she? Why isn't she here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't find any identification with you, Doctor Harris... the driver, who saved your life, disappeared soon after the accident and no one else has come forward. I must apologize, but we had no idea who you were. It sinks in. Martin shakes his head wretchedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus... Liz doesn't know... She'll... she'll be worried sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Doctor Harris, please. Where can we reach your wife? Does she have a cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... yes, she does... it's... I can't remember... His voice trails off. A long beat. Farge asks gently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what you do remember, Martin? Do you remember what day it is? A beat. Giving it thought... then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanksgiving. You told me that. I remember... almost everything. But I don't know how I got here. Another beat. He shakes his head. Scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called retrograde amnesia. With severe trauma of this kind, memories get lost, or fractured. Most return... although it's unlikely you'll ever fully recall the events around your accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, let us see if anyone has filed a report looking for a Martin Harris, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light outside greying into dusk. On the TV, a German chef showing how Americans prepare Thanksgiving dinner. T NURSE comes in; starts to makes a note in Martin's chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife...? Meine Frau... ? Beat. The nurse shakes her head, apologetic. Martin watches a FAMILY, a wife and children, pass his do visiting another patient. He turns his head, stares at his belongings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . His clothes, Neatly laundered and folded, shoes beneath them. A Rolex with a stainless steel band, a ballpoint pe a wad of CASH in a billfold. Three hundred or so Euros, a small blue BOOK. Crinkled, water-stained. Painful effort, he rises, reaches out and picks up the wa It's 6.48. He turns the watch over. An engraving on the backplate: "E.H. to M.H. 7.18.03". FLASH OF MEMORY... Snow falling outside a warmly lit living room. A fire crackles. Martin unwraps a present: The Watch. He turns i over, reads the engraving, smiles up at Liz across from h beautiful, also smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .She gave it to me, our anniversary. The Nurse smiles, shakes her head, not understanding. Martin sets the watch down, picks up the little blue book beside the watch -- 'Horticus' -- the classic botanical reference. He flicks through it, reads the handwritten inscription: "For Martin, that he may discover the worlds inside..." A distant smile...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH OF MEMORY
dialogues.text: Martin as a child sits with his father in his father's st His father shows him the illustrations in the new book. Martin's eyes are wide.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HOSPITAL ROOM
dialogues.text: Martin starts to close the book, tracks some NUMBERS, handwritten on the endpaper. A beat. He shuts the book, glances at the TV, silently playing th local English language TV News: "Prince Fahad arrives in Berlin..." Biotech Forum logo. A striking 30-something Saudi man shakes hands with German dignitaries. A shot of the Hotel Imperial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotel Imperial... I'm here for the Forum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor! Please, get the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-end suite, empty, but with the signs of someone staying there. The phone rings... and rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin fully dressed. Farge has just hung up the phone, trying to reason with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you have to realize the risk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, I've been gone for four days. My wife is out there, in a city she doesn't know. She must be terrified... I need to find her before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Let me call the hotel again. We can leave a message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, fine, but look, I know her. She's looking for me. You're married, aren't you? What would you do? Farge tracks his own wedding band. A long beat. He sighs. Not happy about this at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my card. Any nausea, dizziness, difficulty with speech, you contact me immediately. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Taxi pulls up. Familiar biotechnology forum banner. Martin gets out, strong Deja Vu. Trying to orient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes peeled for a possible glimpse of Liz, Martin heads f elevators. HOTEL SECURITY is everywhere. An entrance to a ballroom is flanked by guards, checking IDs and invitatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DING. Martin steps out into carpeted silence, makes his w down the hall to the 'Eisenhower Suite.' About to knock w he sees the door is ajar. A beat. Martin pushes it open..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Liz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . hallway leads into the spacious sitting room. No one there. Draped over a chair, Martin recognizes Liz's jacke Martin smiles, blinks against tears, he's home. Sound of MOVEMENT from the BEDROOM DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz! I'm here, I... A HOTEL MAID appears from the bedroom door. Startled as s sees Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife... Meine Frau... I'm looking for Mrs. Harris... She suddenly gets him... nodding, pointing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Entpfang... reception...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: World MUSIC. GUESTS flow in through the ornate doors. Mar moves among them. Significantly under-dressed in his tattered jacket, the sutured head injury. Almost at the doors... when a hotel SECURITY GUARD intercepts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Do you have an invitation, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I mean yes... Distracted, still looking at passing faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it with me. My name's Harris, Dr. Martin Harris. I'm on the list. My wife is Elizabeth Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to find her. I've been in the hospital. As the guard checks a screen, a crop-haired man in a chea suit nearby tracks them: HERR STRAUSS, head of hotel security. He approaches, also checks the screen as the gu speaks to him quietly in German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Harris. Do you have any other identification? Passport? Drivers license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already told this gentleman, I've been in the hospital. I was in an accident... Martin sees someone through the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: ENTERING FROM THE FAR DOOR
dialogues.text: a striking, intense-looking man with dark, wiry hair, a designer laptop bag slung over his shoulder. Smiling, arm around his two ten year old daughters, twin GIRLS, pretti dressed. Immediately the center of attention. People movi forward to meet him. Flashguns POP... MARTIN, raises his hand, calling out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Bressler! Words lost in the noise. Martin pushes toward him. But:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Professor Bressler, right there. He knows me, he can confirm who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would be patient, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm done being patient... Martin stops short. Staring past them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her, that's my wife. Over there. By the buffet table.

dialogues.speaker: P.O.V
dialogues.text: Liz. Looking superb in a black evening dress. In conversation with a group of men and women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing her. The look on his face. Processing... an overwhelming mixture of confusion and relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her. That's Liz, my wife. Strauss stares at him blankly. Martin starts to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I have been missing for four days and she has no idea what happened to me! So you need to take me to her, right now. Heads are turning. A beat. Herr Strauss mutters to the guard, then beckons Martin to accompany him inside.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN AND STRAUSS
dialogues.text: thread through the crush. Martin ignoring the glances he' getting. His eyes fixed on Liz... her back to him. A glas of wine in her hand... her golden hair... the ivory skin her shoulders. Strauss taps her on the arm. She half turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me Madam. Your husband is here. He needs to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz... Liz turns fully. That beauty. A flash of surprise as she sees Martin. His clothes. The suture on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Liz, I -- Moving in to embrace her... abruptly she steps away from a flustered look of confusion on her face. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, I... I was in an accident. I was in the hospital, in a coma I'm so sorry, they didn't know who I was ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz stares at him, nonplussed. Her group also staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz...? Please. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just who might 'you' be? Amused whispers. Martin, bewildered, growing angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Martin. Your husband. Liz half smiles, glances around. Is this a joke? To the security guard, flustered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a... misunderstanding. I... I don't know this man. This is my husband... Martin. She calls to a MAN nearby engaged in conversation. Mid-30 like Martin. Elegant, groomed, athletic... conspicuously handsome in a chiselled way. Know him as MARTIN B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Dr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I looked... He checks his name tag. There it is: 'Dr Martin Harris.'

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah... still me. More laughter. Martin pales. A beat. Turns to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- because it really isn't funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: joke about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what I've been through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have no idea what you've been through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in the hospital for four days! Where were you? Were you even trying to find me --?! Moment's strained silence. Strauss unsure what to do, signaling a guard. Martin B steps in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, You seem like you've had an accident, or perhaps --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- who the hell are you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Can you please just get him out of here? Martin rounds on Martin B. Jabs a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Whatever you think you're doing, you need to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, please. This is... He tries to put his hand on her arm. Liz shies away. Mart B between them now. Martin shoving him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way --! Guard GRABS Martin's shoulder. Martin shakes him off. Gua grabs him again. Martin elbows him. A scuffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz --! Please... . Martin's hauled back... away from Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't leave now, sir, we'll have to call the police. Martin pulling free, steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, sardonic) Great! That's the first good idea anyone's had. Call the police. Call the God damn Army!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liz, serious) It's not funny. I was hurt... Liz just stares at him, afraid, anchored to Martin B's ar

dialogues.speaker: TNT. SECURITY CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Seen through glass. A WALL OF MONITORS show images from around the hotel. Inside, Martin sits, surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin rocks in a chair; restless, hands knotted. A FEMAL DETECTIVE watches him. An OLDER DETECTIVE is on the phone Strauss sits near him, studying him, while a TECHNICIAN f forwards 4-PANE video of the hotel reception area, the dr in front of the hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Right there! ON THE VIDEO: Slowing to real-time. Liz, arriving at reception, speaking with the Receptionist, gesturing outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Liz, and I... I must have been outside, I... I can't remember. The video plays on. Liz thanks the receptionist, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see... you're not there. Martin STARES at him, helpless. The Older Detective hangs the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigration confirms the arrival of a Doctor and Mrs. Harris on November 23rd at 16.37. An hour later they checked into their suite at the Hotel. Martin breathes in. Chooses his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not Martin Harris. I am Martin Harris. The man downstairs is pretending to be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this impostor... may I ask? Did he also steal your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Martin searching for a response. The hint of a smile on the female detective's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's forcing her... he must have--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but why? Exactly? .Why? There's no answer to that. Martin looks down. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This... this is insane. He stares at their faces. He calms himself, trying to get grip. A memory resurfacing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lab number... at Dartmouth... Call my assistant, she can verify who I am. Call her right now... He picks up a pad, scribbles down the number. Beat. The female detective picks up the phone, dials. She switches speaker. RINGING TONE. CLICK. A recorded message...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello. This is 235-0535, the office of Doctor Martin Harris. If you're calling... The older detective presses "off". Martin recalling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's Thanksgiving... no one's going to be there till Monday... (racking his brain) Rod... Rodney Cole... he's a colleague. A friend. I know his number... 603-389-4457... Female detective dutifully dials the number. RINGING agai CLICK of a machine. Then a jovial male voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Doctor Cole. I'm having an out-of-office experience right now, so... leave a message. Click. Awkward SILENCE. Martin flailing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Bressler, talk to him. He's why I'm in Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to disturb a Nobel prize winning scientist, simply to attest to your story... when no crime has been committed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it has!... That man has taken everything from me, don't you see? You have to arrest him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Entering the country legally? Presenting all the correct documentation? ON ONE OF THE MONITORS: A view of the Rose Room: Liz and Martin B visible in the corner, dining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the monitor) .And sharing a hotel suite with his wife? Excuse me, your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is my wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if she is your wife, sharing a room with her is not illegal. Not in Germany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitled:) Look at her. Soon we'll have twenty more men claiming to be her husband. The room tries not to laugh, can't help smiling. The moni image flips, now just a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I didn't realize this was funny to you. The Older Detective frowns, offended. The Female Detectiv speaks into her radio. Martin tracks, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... you have no proof you are even American. We can arrest you only for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I was in an accident. I lost... I lost all my -- Wait, what are you doing...? The Female Detective listens to the radio response, nods the Older Man who checks in with Strauss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... You're going to arrest me. You're going to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Monday, you can speak with a lawyer. Tell him who you are. The Older Detective confers with the Female Detective. ON THE MONITORS: the image from the Rose Room reappears: and Martin B visible: laughing, drinking. Martin's gaze darts, panicked: The image. The detectives. Strauss. Martin... coming to a decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, pained) I'm sorry... you're probably right. Faces look over, interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... the accident. I haven't been remembering things, very well. Perhaps this is just... perhaps I'm confused. Martin remembers something, fumbles in his jacket and produces Farge's card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my doctor, at the hospital. He warned me this might happen. I should go back there. I'm really embarrassed... Strauss LEANS in, half convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... now you are saying that you are not Dr. Martin Harris? ON MARTIN. Eyes tight. Point of no return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I won't be any more trouble. You can call the doctor. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin in a humiliated daze as TWO HOTEL GUARDS escort hi out of a service entrance. Dirty pavement, a few bellhops smoke in the cold by a propped-open door. The guards move Martin along, out towards the hotel taxi stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin climbs into the back seat. One of the guards hands Dr. Farge's business card to the driver, speaks to him in German. Door slams, cab starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOTEL
dialogues.text: Even as they pull away, several high-end Mercedes are sweeping up. SAUDI SECURITY get out of the first and last cars, check around before opening the doors of the center car. The man we saw on TV gets out. PRINCE FARAD, flanked by bodyguards and gorgeous female companions. The HOTEL MANAGER and CONFERENCE HEAD greet him, smiles a handshakes, they usher his entourage inside. Martin tracks the Prince, then FOCUSES BEYOND: A view int the hotel bar. Liz and Martin B entering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gaze FIXED on them as the cab starts to move again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! I've changed my mind... Martin thrusts a few bills forward, steps out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRRECH! A large brown Range Rover locks up tires as Mart steps out in front of it. A brief moment, Martin staring into the tinted front glass... can't make out the driver. He holds up his hand, apologizing, makes his way to the street. weaving back through pedestrians, eyes fixed on t bar... FREEZES as he sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans into her, speaks quietly. She nods, intimate, smiles and shakes her head. What an evening... Liz and Martin B get up, leave. She takes his arm, intima heading out to the lobby. P.O.V. DARTING, SEARCHING... PI them up again in... . an EXTERIOR ELEVATOR rising up the side of the building The two of them inside. Alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin walks fast, blind, lost. Miasma of LIGHTS and SOUN Frozen MANNEQUINS in windows... the din of CLUBS and BARS sex-shop neon SIZZLING. Nowhere to go but to keep going. The river. Martin gazes at the dark water...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN'S P. O. V.
dialogues.text: silent free-fall. WHAM! The taxi hits the water. The RATTLE of a U-BAHN TRAIN on a bridge snaps him back. PULSING LIGHTS STROBING like a silent movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faint VOICE in Martin's ear as Rodney Cole recites his message. Hands numb with cold, Martin pumps in change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodney it's me, Martin. Rod, I'm in Berlin for the conference, but it's Liz. She's... I'm in trouble, Rod... Phone issues a DEMAND for more money. Martin fumbles for change, drops a crumpled ball of Euros into the GUTTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Hotel' is a charitable description. Martin counts out sodden bills, hands them to a WOMAN behind the desk. She turn gives Martin a form to fill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fur Reisepaf3... passport... A beat. Martin looks at her, helpless. The woman sighs. Pushes back his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicht Reisepal3, nicht Hotelzimmer. Police... very bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin exits, pulling dirty clothing closed against the c He scans the street, unnerved, frowns as he spots A BROWN RANGE ROVER, up the street, parked, idling. He squints, paranoid, checks the other way... His eyes lock on a lit S-BAHN station across the Platz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin pushes through the turnstiles, his footsteps echo the empty tile corridor as his eyes play over the advertisements. Happy sexy Germans smile back at him... T SOUND OF FOOTSTEPS behind him, matching his. He slowly becomes aware, glances back. MARTIN'S P.O.V.: The empty corridor, curving away... Martin STOPS, listens... nothing. He starts to move again aware that the delicate "click" of the following steps al begins again. UP AHEAD, the corridor straightens out at the train platf several late-night travelers waiting. Martin begins to hurry... the FOOTSTEPS also increase in speed. Another sound: A TRAIN APPROACHING. Martin gives up cool, starts to run as the train barrels into the station, its noise eclipsing all sound. Doors open and Martin leaps in turns to face the open door... .moments pass, the car's bell signals. Then a MAN appears rushing from the corridor, one hand raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitled:) Please! Hold the door! He's mild-faced, glasses, carrying a shopping bag in one hand. He FROWNS as Martin does nothing to stop the door. The two men stare through the glass as the train begins t move. The man shakes his head: foreigners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin shivers with cold and exhaustion, eyes play over t few passengers in the car... a nondescript man a few benc down who stares at him, then back to his paper. Martin eyes him, paranoid. Slowly gives up, lets his gaze plays over the adverts. Times, dates... Nov 26th. Memorie reawakened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has to write something down. Fumbles in his jacket for hi the copy of 'Horticus,' looking for a blank page to write A piece of CARD falls from between its pages. Something printed on one side. Martin flips it over, scribbles on t other: "28th. Bressler. 12.30..." Other times, dates, numbers. Everything he can remember... Sudden overwhelming fatigue. The roar of the train. VOICE Lights racing by the windows. Martin's eyelids droop. Flickering. Closing... SUDDEN FLASH CUT - FRACTURED MEMORY... . LECTURE HALL, younger Liz in the audience. Students CLAPPING. Smiling older colleague SHAKING his hand... becoming... bees' WINGS swarming in their hive... YOUNG MARTIN watching mesmerized through a magnifying glass... their movement morphing into NAKED BODIES. Urgent, passionate. Martin and Liz making love. WHOMPF! SUDDEN SHIFT -- A HOTEL BEDROOM... . Liz towelling her hair. Only now it's dark, and cut short. Turns, smiles at him. Face close. Lips moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin's eyes creak open. The train is still moving, but everything has changed. Morning passengers crowd the car, giving him space. An AMERICAN COUPLE, their bags tucked tight. The WIFE staring down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin runs water, combs his hair with his fingers. Tries press creases out of his stained suit. He stares into the graffiti-stained metal mirror of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to give up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay. Solve the problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sits in front of a stickered and stained monitor, glued to the screen as he types in an URL. The Dartmouth Mail website appears. Martin types in his login, password "Login failed. Please try again."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another attempt. Same results. He switches tactics. Types "Martin Harris" into Google... 605,000 results come back him. On an impulse, he clicks "IMAGES."... .page after page of men young and old. Getting married, posing, partying, historical illustrations... Behind Martin, door jingles, a YOUNG MAN comes into the c seats himself across and to the side of Martin. Martin focuses, tries 'Martin Harris, Phd'... Cursor clic A new window opens. 'The role of Gorytini and Thynnidae i Drakea pollination.' 'Research Faculty information: Dr. Martin Harris...' Contact numbers. No picture. He stares in disbelief... suddenly becomes AWARE of the m across: Young, nondescript, his head bobbing gently to whatever his Ipod earbuds are playing, staring into his computer... The young man looks over, meets Martin's eyes holds for a long moment, small smile, looks back. Martin studies him for a moment, forces his gaze back to page, the negation of his life on a small screen.

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: . Glances over again. Martin catching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? Hello? The guy points to his headphones, shrugs. Martin STARES a his screen, ears listening for the tell tale sound of mus seeping from the earbuds... nothing. Martin rises suddenly, looks to the bored ATTENDANT who n towards the back. Martin moves past college kids on Facebook, to a dim back corridor, a door marked "Manner," what's he's looking for: a back door, cracked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin slips into the alley, trots towards the street, glancing back. No one is following. He moves onto the street, waits at a light... eyes lock o the familiar "Ace Taxi" logo of a taxi passing... SUDDEN FLASH OF MEMORY --: CARTWHEELING TAXI... Silent freefall dive. The 'Ace Taxis' logo... The face in the mirror. Looking back at him. Gina. Eyes meet...

dialogues.speaker: I /E. TAXI DEPOT
dialogues.text: Revving ENGINES. Echoing VOICES. Hunched against the drizzle, Martin pauses outside it. The playing card 'Ace Taxis' logo. Martin ducks under the open steel shutters..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEPOT MANAGER, a bully with a face like boiled meat, rants at Martin in German. BIKO, a gentle-looking Somalia translates. His English is impeccable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he doesn't care if she saved your life... the bitch cost him 20,000 Euros... the insurance won't cover the cab because she had no license... the driver who was letting her moonlight in his taxi, skipped town... The depot manager's rage reaches a Hitlerian climax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . He says illegal immigrants are destroying German society...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. I'm guessing he doesn't know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows where she is. Martin studies Biko, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please thank him for his time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biko exits the depot, starts to tuck in Ipod earphone whe Martin catches up with him, meets his pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, American. I'm sorry we couldn't help you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where she is. You paused. I could tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I just want to thank her. She saved my life. Biko eyes him, wary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought, maybe she could use my help. Maybe I could give her some money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to thank her. Please. Martin puts out his hand, sincere. Biko sizes him up, the takes his hand, shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solomon... Solomon Obiko. My friends just call me Biko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Berlin's 'Little Istanbul'. A Turkish working man's joint Steam rises around a busy food counter. Condensation on t windows. GINA picks up steaming food from the kitchen, drops it of with two Turkish men, chats with them briefly in fast Turkish. There's a bruise around her eye, now healing. She moves to the register where a beefy OWNER counts off week's pay and stuffs it in an envelope for her. She than him in German, tucks it away and ducks behind the counter steam milk for a coffee. Glances up... freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE COUNTER
dialogues.text: . Stares at her, gauging her reaction. A long moment, she looks back down to her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember me. You know who I am. She finishes the Turkish coffee, starts another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in your taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drive a taxi. She takes the two drinks towards a table. He follows. Across the room, the owner eyes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you do. I was in your taxi, we crashed. Why did you leave? Why didn't you talk to the police? Hey! She puts up a hand, calming him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay. How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend, Biko. (cutting her off) It's not his fault. I told him I had money for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean, not now. I -- Gina laughs, shakes her head, tries to push by him. He ge in her way. Eyes from around the room track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Listen to me, I've been in the hospital, since the accident. My memory, it's... I don't remember what happened but something is going on and there are some people I need you to speak to. I need you to tell them what happened. Gina ducks back behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, things have been happening to me. I think I'm being followed. That got her attention. Her eyes lift, scan outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my only link to before everything went...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, crazy... but it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owner is now.really watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me -- She rounds on him. Patience snapping. Pushes through door gesturing him with her into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .pots, pans, food bubbles. Immigrant cooks work, glace up but speak no English. Gina, really angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect me to do? I'm an illegal, driving a taxi without a permit, in an accident without insurance. If the cops catch up with me they'll throw me in jail. If I'm in jail, I lose everything, understand? If I'm in jail, they deport me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not listening to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's you who is not listening. You're an American. Go to your fancy embassy. Go to the Police. There a million people here who will help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Harris, Doctor M --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fantastic, you're Martin Harris. You're whoever you say you are. Yes, I picked you up and we crashed. It doesn't mean I know who you are! She backs off, a hand raised against him. He STARES after her, the truth of what she's said hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was I going? In the taxi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...? (beat, softening) To the airport. Arrivals. You were in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'd just arrived. It doesn't make any sense... She raises her hands, enough. He looks at her, takes in t bruise on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got hurt, too. In the crash. (off her shrug) Thank you. For saving my life. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have done the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You can't be sure how you'll act. Not until something like that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I know me. I jump in without thinking. It causes me lot of trouble. She looks up at him. Meets his eyes square for the first time. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So please. Just leave me alone. He nods. She turns, pushes back into the restaurant. He watches her explaining to her boss... Then turns away, towards a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluorescent lights. Linoleum floor. Martin sits in a smal plastic chair filling out paperwork. Alone. The place is closing early for the long weekend. A man opens a door, looks at Martin. Martin Harris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARC SPIEGLER is German, fluent English. Patient, but wishing he was on his way home as well. He looks over Martin's paperwork as Martin places his watch and the "Horticus" book on the table. Where the form asks for a complaint, Martin has written "Identity Theft."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Have you contacted your Credit Card companies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand. As I explained to the last guar -- who went home by the way -- it's not about Credit Cards. Someone has taken over my identity. Someone is pretending to be me. Here. In Berlin. Spiegler nods, sensing this won't be an easy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you contact the local authorities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They... They believe the other man. I need a new passport, papers to prove -- Spiegler sighs, a mixture impatience and sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they believe the other man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... Because my wife. He's staying with my wife. They must be forcing her -- Spiegler suppresses a small laugh, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I know how it sounds? Let me ask you this, if my wife was having some hot and heavy affair with another man, why not just leave me? Why this? After all, we're in Europe, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiegler burns, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I need a passport. (tapping the forms) I need the documents that this embassy is supposed to provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know, the things people will do to get a US Passport...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, we're closing until Monday. If you come back then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monday?! They've kidnappedmy wife. You need to find out who this other man is, you need to be in contact with my wife -- Spiegler exhales, cuttint Martin off. He picks up Martin' Rolex, glances at the initials. Looks at his copy of 'Horticus', the inscription on the inside cover. As he do a slip of paper comes loose, Martin picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand, we're not a detective agency, we... Spiegler stops, sensing Martin isn't listening anymore. Martin's staring at the slip of paper where on one side i scribbled: "28th. Bressler. 12.30 pm..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a meeting with Bressler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. You've been very unhelpful. Earlier a woman yelled at me because I had it so easy... being an American. Have a nice day... Spiegler watching him. Second thoughts. Consults his address book. Scribbles down a number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Martin Harris. Here... Martin takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old friend. He needs work, and he's good at finding things. He may be able to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavernous lobby, echoing VOICES and FOOTSTEPS. Ancient brickwork and tile contrast with new-age furniture and technology. An atomic clock reads 12.35. Martin heads to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I need to find Professor Bressler's lab. I have an appointment at 12.30... I'm late... The female RECEPTIONIST behind the desk consults her scre Beat. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Martin Harris. The professor knows who I am. We scheduled this meeting weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The professor knows you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we haven't met, but we've been corresponding. He invited me here to discuss my thesis. Dr. Martin Harris... She frowns, rises from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there some sort of problem? No answer, she disappears into a back office. Martin shak his head, exasperated. He scans the building plan on the wall... 'Bressler. L.P - Molekulare Botanik - 305'... Suddenly about-turns, heads for the stairs. The woman out the office. SEES him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nein... eingang ist verboten:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly grabs the phone on the desk, speed-dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surreal. Rows of head-height CORN in a large humid chambe under bright lights. Above, ancient rusting girders and brick. Insects HUM. RESEARCH STUDENTS clip seed spikelets bagging and logging the samples. Martin slips quickly in through a door, unseen. Heat and moisture hitting him. Above the drone of bugs... VOICES. Martin tenses. He recognizes one of them...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Drakea, named after Anthea Drake, the English botanist who wondered how it manages to reproduce when it doesn't appear to attract any insects... A wave of anger... that's Martin's work he's discussing! THE OTHER SIDE OF THE LAB - MARTIN B WITH BRESSLER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's puzzling, one wonders how -- Bressler stops talking. Stares past Martin B at MARTIN, heading toward them down a corn row, eyes burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Bressler... Martin B turns, sees him. His eyes harden. But it's Bressler who speaks first. Alarmed, indignant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This laboratory is a restricted area. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Professor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- how did you get in here? Are you absolutely out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor. He is not Martin Harris. I am Martin Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a conversation stopper. Bressler looks to Martin B who shakes his head, embarrassed. Martin pointing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh, Jesus... A phone RINGS somewhere in the room. It's picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is this? Some sort of hybridized propagation? There are two Martin Harrises?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... let me explain. This man showed up at the hotel last night. Security had to remove him. The police were called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called the police, you sonofabitch --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- seems he checked himself out of the hospital. He was in an accident of some sort. . one of the research students CALLS to Bressler in Germa Martin catches the word "polizei". A surge of panic. He looks around. Sees a straw he can grasp at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drakea Drakensis... Miss Drake was wrong... . the PLANT SAMPLE on the table behind Bressler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single insect was attracted, but she couldn't see it. It's too small and it moves too fast. Thynnidae. It's a kind of wasp, but it looks like an ant. Only the males have wings. The orchid re-produces the pheromones of the female wasp to lure it in. It's a trick. It's pretending to be something it isn't... Bressler looks to Martin. Surprised... curious now. Marti sees his opening. Hope in his voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked... you and I... on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we discussed your interest in alternative forms of propagation. I told you about my father, a school teacher... his passion for science... how he passed that on to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't believe it! You've been listening to my calls? Just who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd like to do the same for my kids. You talked about your children... Two girls... right? Yeah... their -- His voice falters... tails off into silence. Searching hi memory. Expression shifting to one of panic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you told me their names... I can't... I know them... I... Martin B picks up for him. Icy clarity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Laurel, and Lily. Martin frozen as Martin B goes on...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Twins... ten years old. The same age I was when I told my father I wanted to be a botanist. We discussed that on the phone, Professor... how I'd never seen him so happy. Martin sways on his feet, sweat beading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That wasn't you. Don't you remember? We spoke of how brave our wives were to marry ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to marry scientists. I told you about our honeymoon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- our honeymoon in Paris. My wife and I. Liz wanted to go to the museums. All I wanted to do was visit the --

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: but she insisted and . but she insisted and that's how I first saw that's how I first saw Leonardo's Vitruvian Man! Leonardo's Vitruvian Man!. A beat, a breath. Bressler looking between them. Wow...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look STOP IT! Martin B suddenly seems to SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN B, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my wife we're talking about! My father, whom I loved. You may think it's funny, but it's my life. Whatever sick pleasure this gives you -- I'm tired of it. I'm done. You need to... STOP. Martin just STARES at the Martin B who's shaking, upset. Like looking in a mirror that has taken your emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... this isn't happening... . the POLICE suddenly there. Two OFFICERS. Bressler signals for them to stay back. Martin lifts his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm... He's not... A beat. Martin B shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I need to do this... He reaches in his jacket. Produces a passport. Martin B's face. Dr. Martin Harris. Then he opens his wallet. Credit cards, New Hampshire driver's license... a PHOTOGRAPH in wallet's plastic sleeve... Martin sees the photograph. His EYES WIDEN...

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: . dog-eared with age. A younger Martin B with Liz. In the Tuileries in Paris, his arm around her. The image CLOSER BLURRING out of FOCUS... VERTIGO SPIN... The floor RUSHIN UP... WHAM! Then NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flickering like a candle in darkness. Suddenly CLOSER. BLINDING. Voices behind the light. A distorted form slowl TAKES SHAPE. A familiar bearded FACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. FARGE fans a penlight across Martin's eyes. Propped up on a gurney. Flinches at the glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police brought you here. The mistake was mine. I should never have let you leave. Martin blinks, bleary. Farge talks briefly to the nurse i German. She nods, starts prepping a hypodermic at a table Farge looks back to Martin. Explains gently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion... memory loss... the complete or partial loss of identity... these are common stages in recovery. Some temporary, others longer term. We're going to do an MRI. Try to find out what's happening. Martin stares out the window, not fighting, hardly listen A bird alights on a branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mind is like a jigsaw puzzle. The pieces fit together to create the person we are. With major trauma, the puzzle is shattered. But the brain's ability to recover is remarkable. The mind needs a narrative, an identity... a soul. Without memory, without a past, we are nothing. In the coma state, memories are rebuilt. In some cases the pieces move. In others they go missing. And sometimes... completely new pieces are found. The bird flies off. Martin's eyes track... empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comas sometimes perform a kind of alchemy. A patient awakes convinced of a reality that was previously only fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New men, in effect, with new lives... new loves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor... Do you know what it feels like, to become insane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..There is quite a lot of literature on the subject. But finally, I would say it's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you. Martin looks over, Farge almost RECOILS at the intensity Martin's eyes. Fear. Loss. Anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a war, between what you know... He taps his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and what you believe. His hand moves down his body to his chest, taps his heart He LEANS towards Farge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .who do you think wins? Martin SMILES. Tight, hurting, fatalistic. Farge, almost afraid, nods to the nurse who slips the needle in. MARTIN'S P.O.V. -- THE NURSE'S FACE FADING INTO... Far-off VOICES. Gurney MOVING beneath him. Looking up. Lights passing. RHYTHMIC SOUND of the wheels becoming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Claustrophobic nightmare; a support holds Martin's head rigid, earphones piping soothing CLASSICAL MUSIC, but the noise of the machine is all-engulfing. DUNN-DUNN-DUNN. Th sound DEAFENING. Scanner moving over him... Martin's eyes empty... far far away. SMASH CUT INTO MEMORY - FRACTURED IMAGES... Undulating bodies moving over each other, Martin and Liz making love. Urgency building. Suddenly SHIFTING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Martin B and Liz drinking in the hotel bar... she leani over, whispering to him, intimate.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: an abrupt jolt. Electric WHINE. Platform moves, sliding Martin out of the tube. His eyes open, take in the room.

dialogues.speaker: TWO ORDERLIES
dialogues.text: .tending to him. One raises a needle, injects a CLOUDY SUBSTANCE into Martin's IV bag... .The MRI Control Booth, empty. Martin squints, a little confused. He raises his eyes, looks into the face of the from the Internet Cafe! Call him JONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his mind struggles to compute. The sudden overwhelming realization that he's not insane. This man is HERE. His eyes DART as the other orderly glances over, the man from train tunnel. Call him SMITH. He smiles at Martin, polite nondescript. Ghostly in his disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Martin. This won't take very long. Martin tries to raise up but can't move -- his arms and l are like lead. He opens his mouth to call out, his voice barely a murmur. His eyes lock on the IV bag, the steady drip... drip... down the line into his body... The two men quickly lift Martin, hefting him face-down on gurney. One arm dangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The Men's shoes, thick soled, black. Linoleum Tile. Wheels of the gurney. -- Jones, stuffing his clothes and effects into a plastic bag, tossing them under the gurney. Smith pushing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitles:) Excuse me, where are you taking this patient? Martin's vision RACKS, traces the Nurse's white sneakers, standing in the now open doorway to the room. Martin STRA to yell, to speak, nothing. He can just move his head eno to eyeball the IV. Drip... drip... drip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitles:) We have instruction to move this patient to the American Hospital at Wiesbaden. Here are the papers. The rustle of paper. Martin CONCENTRATES, eyes on the IV tube, hanging between the bars of the gurney and his arm. Great Effort, He LEANS, pinching the tube closed. CLOSE ON THE IV: The drips... stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitles:) I'm surprised I wasn't informed... Let me check with -- A SOUND, like paper torn quick... and THE NURSE FALLS TO THE FLOOR, STARING UP AT MARTIN, HER THROAT CUT. Martin gazes down at her in HORROR as she bleeds out, sta upwards at him, the light in her eyes dying. Around him Smith and Jones start to MOVE, locking the doo opening cabinets, working fast, Martin's eyes lock on: a of scissors, tucked in her apron. Eyes watering, adrenaline surging, Martin WILLS his hand reach down, palm the scissors, just as the Nurse's body i dragged away, leaving a trail of red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MRI ROOM door opens, the two 'orderlies' wheel the ba conscious Martin out into the corridor. Behind them, the room is spotless. They round a corner, almost at the EXIT... Doors ahead BL OPEN. Doctors, Paramedics rushing forward with various WOUNDED on gurneys. Something big has happened. Smith and Jones eye the madness coming their way, command decision, they duck into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . where a feeble OLD MAN mumbles at them from his bed. They ignore the man, go about checking Martin. Jones lift his head, pries open one eyelid after the other while Smi ties down his arms, covers him with a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door OPENS. A DOCTOR, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitles:) You two. We need help!. Right now! (off their hesitation)

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: No choice. They exit after the doctor, Jones glancing bac at Martin as the door swings shut behind them. A beat. The covered shape on the gurney starts to MOVE. Martin's hand saws back and forth, using the scissors to the straps that bind him. ACROSS, the Old Man tracks the motion... scared. Success! A strap gives way. Martin paws the blanket weakl away. Feels along his arm, and pulls out the IV. Blood drips. He rises up, trying to orient...

dialogues.speaker: FLARED, DISTORTED
dialogues.text: . the old MAN staring at him... DAZZLING daylight framed a window... strange reverberating ECHOES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . pulls himself upright. Tries to stand, but his body is like Jello. Reaches out, grabs the leg of a steel equipme trolley which TEETERS... CRASHES to the floor, showering Martin with a CASCADE of instruments and dressings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS RING. Emergency team clusters around a lifeless PATIENT, working fast. Smith and Jones, resentfully holdi drip bags. They heard that. Turn, eyes meeting. Set down their drip bags. Edge back toward the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith and Jones, hurrying down the hall. Quick check into the patient's room reveals Martin GONE, the old man GESTURING, panicked... They moves on, fast, around a corner into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very busy. Patients... doctors and nurses. Smith and Jone push into the room, scanning... see:

dialogues.speaker: A FAMILIAR FIGURE
dialogues.text: shuffling towards the doors! Given away by the plastic bag and the hospital gown showing under the jacket. BAM! Entrance doors SLAM OPEN. PARAMEDICS charge in, wheeling in MORE ACCIDENT PATIENTS on a gurneys past Mart as he exits. Smith and Jones break into a run, trying to press through TWO MORE CREWS coming through with more CRA VICTIMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOS here. Ambulances arriving, departing. Crews slammin their rigs closed, taking off, SIRENS WAILING. Other arriving with wounded... Smith and Jones rush out of the hospital doors, pull up. many ambulances, the crowds... no sign of Martin.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. AMBULANCE/ BERLIN STREETS
dialogues.text: Cop cars and fire trucks surround an accident scene where truck has side-swiped a trolley-car. Ambulance pulls up behind them. PARAMEDICS jump out, one of them pulling ope the back doors... startles as he finds Martin, now dressed back in his clothes, a reassuring hand held up, climbing out unsteadi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... I'm fine... Paramedic would do something, but his colleague's YELLING him to hurry. Just has to watch Martin go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . weaving down the busy sidewalk, buffeting against annoy shoppers. Looks behind to see if he's being followed. Nobody. Keeps pressing on, finally arriving at

dialogues.speaker: A FOOD CART
dialogues.text: tended by a Middle-Eastern Man who stares at Martin. Martin eyes warm Gyros and Souvlakis, rummages for money. comes out with just a slip of paper with writing on it: T slip the man from the embassy wrote on. He focuses, his mind clearing: A name: Jurgen. An address It's something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CORONER's hand slides a zipper closed, past the lifeles eyes of the Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The two DETECTIVES from the Hotel Imperial sit with Farge pours himself a drink with remorseful hands. The entire scene in German, subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .The man's condition was unusual, yes. But there was nothing to indicate violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still dangerous? Farge watches the Coroner wheel away the Nurses's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To someone who threatens that fantasy...? Yes. I believe he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metro train car almost empty, save for a few noticeably d at-heel passengers. Martin looks up at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleak, uniform blocks of Communist-era housing. Graffiti- covered walls: hammers and sickles, swastikas... Martin s outside one, checks the address on the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urine stench. Water pooling on concrete. 'Gebrochen' sign blocking off the elevator. Martin climbs the steps. Approaching FOOTFALLS, SHOUTS from above. A group of youn SKINHEADS thunders past him, on downward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin presses a bell. Hears it RINGING. No answer. A doo behind him OPENS. A grey-haired LADY peers out. A beat. Martin tries the BELL again. COUGHING from inside, the so of a LOCK. The door half opens... revealing ERNST JURGEN. Piercing eyes in a face far older than its sixty-some years. Frayed suit jacket, stai shirt; grey hair yellowed by nicotine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alles in ordnung, Frau Brunner. He smiles. Frau Brunner retreats back behind her door. Jurgen turns to Martin. Eyes reading him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen leads Martin down a hallway piled with books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siegler used to work for me. Did he tell you that? His laughter becomes a COUGH that racks his body. Lets it pass, before ushering Martin into a tiny living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down... Points Martin toward a battered chair. opens a bottle of cheap brandy, pours two glasses. Turns to find Martin looking at FRAMED PHOTOS on the sideboard... . a YOUNGER JURGEN in East German army uniform... in a large office... smiling beside a Russian-made sedan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Staatssicherheit. The Ministry for State Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where Spiegler worked for you? The secret police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A true believer, like the rest of us. Now look at him. I should have had him shot. Another laugh, more COUGHING. Hands Martin a brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forgot. Germans are experts at forgetting. We forgot we were Nazis. Now we've forgotten forty years of Communism. All gone. But it's not just history that's forgotten. It's people, too. He sinks into a chair. Tired smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But enough of me...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jurgen jots notes in a pad. Hand unsteady, he perches his cigarette on the ashtray, picks up the 'Horticus'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always have it with me. It was a gift from my father... Jurgen flips it open. Notices the inscription, the NUMBER written inside the front endpaper. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's my wife's handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, they mean something to her. He looks to Martin. Direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her involvement in this. There must have been something... in the past... some indication? A beat. Martin shakes his head, at a loss. Jurgen leafs on... the piece of CARD drops from between the pages. Jur picks it up. Martin's notations from the night before in train: times... dates... places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My schedule... for this week. It's everything I remember. Jurgen turns over the card. German print. A cheery cartoo Uncle Sam: 'Uncle Sam's Bowling & Billiards'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Rodney Cole told us to go, said it was a blast.

dialogues.speaker: LATER STILL
dialogues.text: Tapping his pencil on the pad... intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passport, credit cards, family photos... things like these take time to prepare. You say this man has detailed knowledge of your research, of your relationship with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Bressler. He knows everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including the fact that you were going to have a random accident that would allow him seamlessly to take your place? These people may be good, but they're not God. The question is, why would they want to take your place? What could they gain from being you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, did you a favor I'd say. Now you have... Redlichkeit... Now you know you are right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe me? A beat. Jurgen pours them both another brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Stasi, we had a basic principle: Ask enough questions and a man who is lying will eventually change his story. But a man who tells the truth cannot change his, however unlikely his story sounds. I believe you are telling the truth, Doctor Harris. A long beat. Jurgen closes the notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start by calling these numbers again... as you say, it's Thanksgiving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and there's the time difference, so it may take time to make contact. And then there is the question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of money... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of money. Martin takes off his Rolex. Sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all I have. I'll pay you in cash as soon as I can. Jurgen nods, picks up the watch. Turns it, looks at the engraving on the back. As Martin turns to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Harris... A wince of pain as Jurgen gets up. Lifts a tea tin off th shelf. Opens it. Takes out a hundred Euros...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loan against your guarantee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need twenty-four hours. Call me tomorrow afternoon. Do you have a place to stay? A long beat. Off Martin's FACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina is cleaning up for the night, counting her tips, jot numbers in a small notebook. The television plays the evening news quietly. In a corner, her boss is tallying t days receipts at a table. Gina ducks under the counter, calls out to a man who's pa in a corner seat, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Turkish, subtitled:) Hey, friend. We're closing... The man looks up: It's Martin. He's exhausted, wet. His eyes full of need and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Please. I had nowhere else to go... She starts to respond, holds it back. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to know. The man you picked up, the man who's life you saved. That was me, right? It was me. She looks down at him, moved. Eyes track his wedding ring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're married. What about your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine what it's like, to wake up one day, and your life... has been erased. Beat. He starts to rise, collect himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you. Martin Harris. You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He starts to go. She puts a hand on his arm. He stares at it. Human contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot. Come on... He hesitates, then lets her lead him out of the cafe. In the corner, the owner watches them go. The TV NEWS changes, flashes a special. The Owner looks up: ON TELEVISION: Martin's face, caught by a camera at the hospital. Juxtaposed next to it, a smiling picture of the Nurse. German text scrolls: "Wanted for Murder..." The Owner's hand moves, picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: E/I. STREET / RANGE ROVER
dialogues.text: The Brown Range Rover idles on the street. Exhaust plumes Inside, two figures statue in silence. Smith and Jones. Waiting. The engine idles, the vents blow heat. Suddenly, an ELECTRONIC SCRAMBLER on the dashboard SQUAWKS in Germa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina walk side by side, unused to the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how long are you married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yale... I was a teaching assistant. Liz heard me lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's no way she just didn't... recognize you? He shakes his head. They reach the cement steps of an overpass, climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .You don't have to believe me. It's crazy, I know. Gina pauses, stares through chain-link at the cars below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a story... Where they came from, where they are going, what happened to them. Why they're not happy, or alone. ( l ooking over) Who cares what I believe. It's bullshit. All that matters is... (pokes his chest) Who you are, what you do, right now. She reaches in her jacket. Opens the notebook she was writing in. Columns of figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me. 2,259 Euros and counting. The number's the only thing that changes. I reach 4000, I can buy papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe I'll come home one day and find a stranger who claims to be me. I'd like that. Walk away. Leave it all behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could do that. Martin shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd still have my memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? We're different. You like your memories. very American of you. He nods. She shrugs, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
