dialogues.text: Key in the lock, door opens. Gina shows Martin in. Run-down but clean. Rainwater seeps in through the window Martin sits, watches Gina as she goes to a sideboard and uncorks a bottle. Pours Martin a glass of clear liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slivovic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He takes a sip. Then another. Gina watching him. Muffled TV and arguing VOICES in Turkish from the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are made of cardboard... but it's home. Another smile, tired. A long beat. Abruptly, Gina gets up and leaves the room. Sound of drawers opening.

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You can sleep on the floor in there. I have an extra mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reappears... tosses something to Martin. A sweater, a pair of man's jeans. Before he can speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night-owl STUDENTS and BACK-PACKERS at rows of terminals, fingers tapping. The unlikely figure of Jurgen waits in t line at the counter. Signs in, gets his swipe key.

dialogues.speaker: AT A COMPUTER TERMINAL
dialogues.text: Moment's thought, Jurgen types Martin Harris Ph.D into th search window. Hits return. CLOSE on the list, the same Martin got. No pictures. Jurgen writes something in his notebook. Types again... 'World Bio-technology Forum' homepage. Schedule... delegates... speakers... photo of Bressler, sub-heading: 'Keynote Address'... An enlarged color PHOTO: Guest of Ho and forum sponsor Prince Fahad. Google search results... NEWS HEADLINES: 'Saudi Prince in assassination attempt'... 'Failed killing highlights controversial figure in Arab world'... Another CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: SCREEN
dialogues.text: Al-Jazeera News footage. Fahad at a press conference. Sudden shift of focus, someone approaching the podium. Security move to intercept. EXPLOSIVE FLASH of a grenade. Blood on the lens, hand-held pandemonium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cafe Owner is still watching the local news, looking another glimpse of Martin. Door jingles. He glances over see two men, one holding up a POLICE Badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitled:) You guys are quick... The BADGE lowers. It's Jones. Looks utterly nonthreatenin plain. But the Owner's voice falters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin sets the borrowed clothing down on the bed, looks around himself as he takes off his jacket. Intimate, to be in here. Photographs on a cluttered vanit Old country, Bosnia. Men in suits and women in long dress Children, a boy and two girls... Gina?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Gina goes to the fridge, removes a pot of plain stew and it on the stove. She uses a spoon to pull off a chunk of fatty meat. Drops it on a chipped plate and opens the window... leaning out into the rain, Gina reaches up, slides the plate onto a sloping roof above. Excited YOWLS as stray c come running from every direction. Gina ducks back inside, pulls the window shut, glances towards the cracked door to her bedroom as she ducks into bathroom, turns on the hot water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light's bust so you have to leave the door open if you want to see anything. Don't worry, I won't peek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RANGE ROVER pulls up outside the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin takes off his shirt, lays it down. Notices several charcoal drawings, tucked behind a radiator. He pulls a f out. A lonely man in the park. A woman with her child. Dark, shadowed... Beautiful. Gina clears her throat. Martin looks over, sees Gina standing in the doorway, realizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry, I just... I'm sorry. Did you do these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you a place to stay, it doesn't give you the right to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right... (putting them back) I'm sorry. They're beautiful. You should --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should what? Have been an artist? Perhaps in Bosnia... (beat, quoting him) "Can you imagine what it's like, to wake up one day. And your whole life... has been erased?" He STARES at her, moved. That connection again. He looks away. Looks back again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes... It's the one thing I remember about the accident. Your eyes in the mirror... He tails off. Face-to-face... BANG! BANG! Pounding on the door. Gina motions Martin out of sight as she opens the door... .It's Biko, the soft-spoken Somali taxi-driver. He grins. Tries teasingly to peek past her into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got company? She puts her foot against the door, inscrutable. Biko dro a set of keys into her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it back to my place. Leave the keys on the TV. And don't forget to reset the meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best. She pecks him on the cheek. Biko pushes in the door, just little, but enough to catch Martin, in his undershirt, carrying the rest of his clothes, halfway to the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm just going... in here. Biko looks at Gina, raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. I sleep with every married American you send my way -- Thank you for that, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no need to explain to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on your way! Go! She pushes him out, closes the door. The stew has started SMOKE. Gina moves it off the burner.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: Biko trots down stairs, laughing to himself. Passes two m working on the PHONE BOX tucked below the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitled:) Hey, while you're at it, check the line to number eight. She's always getting bad service. One of the men lifts his face. It's JONES. Biko takes the in, their clothes... frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen making a call, rain dripping off his coat. "The Eye". Banks of CCTV SCREENS monitoring Tegel's passenger areas. Night-shift STAFF sip coffee. An incoming CALL. DESK OFFICER answers. Calls to an older UNIFORMED MAN, who picks up, punches a button.

dialogues.speaker: JURGEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (German, subtitles:) Hans. It's Colonel Jurgen. From the old days. I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina punches PLAY on an old boom-box and a cool Bosnian h hop groove plays. She spoons some of the stew into a bowl sets it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Martin lets the hot water run over his head, drip across face, allowing himself a tiny moment of relaxation.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: BANG! BANG! Knocking on the door again. Gina puts the bow in the sink, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment, Biko. And you're going to be late -- She throws open the door... SMITH and JONES press in! Jon clamping a hand over her mouth. Watching them work is awe-inspiring, chilling. There's no wasted motion whatsoever. Their faces calm, observant. Jones holds Gina, gun covers the dark entrance to the bathroom where the shower still runs as Smith turns the m up LOUD, then opens the oven, blows out the pilot light, turns on the gas... CLOSE ON THE GAS -- A hazy layer, rippling over the floor Smith grabs a candle off Gina's table, lights its wick, sets it on top of the stove.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DARK BATHROOM
dialogues.text: PRESSED against the wall, trapped, fully aware of what's _ going on, Martin. He's pulled on clothes. By looking in small mirror over the sink, he can see the men going abou their work. He can see their weapons. His eyes SEARCH for anything useful, anything at all. There's nothing. He reaches towards the small window to t exterior. It swings open, revealing the FIRE ESCAPE beyon

dialogues.speaker: IN THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: The gas HISSES as it spills into the room. Smith grabs th bottle of alcohol, douses Gina as with one hand Jones produces a hypodermic... . A LOW THUMP from the bathroom. Smith REACTS instantly, KICKS in the bathroom door, gun lined...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . on NOTHING. The empty shower runs. The window to the exterior swings gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror-stricken, realizing Martin has abandoned her. Jones nods to Smith who goes out the door, covers the hal Jones FLIPS Gina onto her stomach, presses her face to th floor, pulling down the top of her pants as he prepares t inject her with the hypodermic. She struggles, SCREAMS IN RAGE, chokes on the gas. Her EY WIDEN as Jones slides the needle in, starts to PRESS... . CRASH! Martin blasts in from the fire escape, through the window nearest them, catching Jones in the face, cutt his face. He tumbles over -- his gun sliding away...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN AND JONES
dialogues.text: . Tumble together, SMASH into the sideboard which collapses, splintering into the kitchen. Martin tries to hit Jones who easily deflects the blow, l cat-like to his feet, moving towards his gun as Smith re- enters, weapon drawn, and FREEZES, his eyes tracking: THE CANDLE, teetering on the stove... now falling over... rolling... Jones, Smith, Martin... all track the candle, its progres towards the edge of the stove... Jones and Smith RUN towards the door. Martin grabs Gina, HAULS her towards the bedroom as the candle falls... KABOOM --!!! GAS EXPLODES. Doors SPLINTER outward... . BLAST hurls Gina and Martin onto the bedroom floor. Martin covering Gina. PRESSURE WAVE sweeps over them, burning debris raining. FRACTURED VISION... TINNITUS DAZE... Fires spreading, the main room beyond the bedroom an INFE Martin pulls Gina up. They move to the window and the fir escape. Gina begins to slide it open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, look! She tracks his gaze: Down below, Jones exits the building looks up amidst other onlookers. Wipes blood from his fac Martin looks around, wild, for anything, his gaze settlin on: the far wall. Flames FLARE in, growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a ROAR Martin rushes the wall, IMPACTS it with his shoulder, goes right through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LANDS HARD in a small empty bedroom, Turkish decorated. Drywall and plaster everywhere. Gina follows him through they thread through the abandoned flat out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina slip out a door, into a crowd of immigran families, other residents fleeing down the stairwell. Smo is thick, flames roar.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Laying in wait near the entrance to Gina's place. Hand tucked in his coat. Gaze RACKS, looking for another way..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go up... He starts to pull her, but she's FROZEN, staring in horro Martin tracks her gaze: Biko's body, tucked under the stairs. Lifeless eyes stare back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immigrant families emerge from the flaming building. Jone stands next to the Range Rover, eyes tracking the crowd, upper floors, now engulfed in flame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina emerge at the top, run to the edge. He LEANS... reaching across to the next building... BELOW HIM: Five flights down. A mortal fall. Martin's hands grip a ledge, pull him over. He reaches ba pulls her across. They keep moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds parting as FIRE TRUCKS scream around the corner. Smith comes out, the last to exit the building. He meets eyes with Jones, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina emerge from the neighboring building. See Smith climbing into the Range Rover. Martin takes Gina's arm, steers her away. Notices an old Mercedes Diesel taxi at the curb, covered in debris. Biko

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys. Where are the keys? Gina stares at him, lost. Martin reaches into her pockets Finds Biko's keys. He HAULS broken panes, debris off the car, manages to get it open. He bundles her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin fumbles the key into the ignition. He turns it. Warning light delay as the diesel's glow-plugs warm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. C'mon... IN THE REARVIEW: The Range Rover, making a U-Turn, headin their way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones drives, Smith shotgun. They cruise slowly, keeping eye peeled. Pass the debris-covered taxi, empty. They kee moving, gaze still tracking. Smith pops his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: I./E. TAXI/KREUZBERG DISTRICT STREETS
dialogues.text: Crouched down, Martin watches in the mirror as the Range Rover turns a corner. He restarts the engine, puts the ca in gear and pulls them away from the curb. Gina still in stunned silence. Wipes tears and grime off face. She looks across at Martin. He glances up at the mirror... sudden change in his expression. Gina turns, sees...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: Four cars back. Jones driving. Smith riding shotgun. Face expressionless as they swerve out into traffic, deftly cu back in one vehicle closer to Martin and Gina. Gina turns back to Martin. Eyes wide. This can't be happening. Adrenaline clearing her mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left --! Turn left... Martin spins the wheel. Taxi swerves across oncoming traf into a SIDE-STREET. Gina waving frantically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left again! Left again! Now right. Here. HERE! Just in time, Martin pulls a right. Cab drifts, SLAMS a w side-on... bounces back into the center of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! A look from Martin: What? Gina glances behind. No sign of them. Moment's relief. Turns to her right. Sees the RANGE ROVER racing down the parallel side-street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to cut us off! Right. Turn right -- ! Martin SCREECHES into a turn. Heads for the parallel alle Range Rover FLASHES through the intersection just ahead. Taxi cuts across feet behind them...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RANGE ROVER
dialogues.text: Jones spots the taxi in the mirror. BRAKES, high speed 180... races back up the alley.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Martin floors the gas. SCREAMS out into oncoming traffic, across a red light. Zig-zags past cars. Edge of control. Zooms through open gates into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tree-lined avenue. Closed GATES at the far end... . Range Rover moving fast down the street alongside the cemetery. Suddenly cutting left across traffic. Bounces over the curb, full-speed into the grounds. 4WD slaloming past gravestones, rapidly closing on the taxi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed gates ahead. No choice. Martin puts his foot down. SMASHES through the gates. Flying hinge SLAMS the windshi -- glass instantly spidering opaque... Martin driving blind. Careens against the embankment, WHIPLASHES up, spin on its axis. Rolling... over the edge of the embankment, TUMBLING over and over. SLAMS DOWN right way up, axles crumpling. QUIET. Steaming HISS of the engine. Martin's hands still locked on the wheel. Gina next to hi Martin shoves open the door. Clambers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maze of tracks and power lines below street level. S-Ba U-Bahn, high-speed ICE trains, freight... tracks disappearing in each direction into tunnels. A sound. Martin turns, looks up... THE RANGE ROVER, Jones at the wheel... SPOTS THEM. Engine GUNS, Range Rover plunges headlong down the embankment... Whistling ROAR... as a HIGH SPEED TRAIN hurtles out of th one of the tunnels. Martin grabs Gina's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...! Running side-by-side. Train horn BLASTS as they cross rig in front of it as the Range Rover, cut off, SPINS 90 degr races down the tracks alongside it. Martin and Gina scramble across tracks, towards a tunnel. . the Range Rover passes the back of the train. HARD right, over the tracks. Too Fast. The car catches air... . BELLIES down hard onto the next set of tracks. Front tire EXPLODES... . Range Rover SPINS... rear wheels SLAM the track. Another tire BURSTS. Scraping STOP, car straddling the rails. Jones shifts into reverse. Rims SPI against metal.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE TRACKS
dialogues.text: . Martin and Gina sprinting towards the tunnel. Smith jumps out of the Range Rover, lines his weapon. BLAM! BLA

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina hit the ground, bullets chipping ceramic the walls. Up ahead, illuminated, some utility stairs. Gi GASPS air, spent. Martin looks behind them...

dialogues.speaker: SMITH IN SILHOUETTE. COMING IN AFTER TH
dialogues.text: Martin GRABS Gina, pulls her after him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RANGE ROVER
dialogues.text: Jams shift into 'drive.' Pedal to metal. Four wheel drive rims SCREAM on the rails, inches forward. Almost off the tracks. A vibration. Jones looks around... FREIGHT CARS -- LUMBERING RIGHT FOR HIM... Shunted by a rear engine; no way the driver can see him. Scrambles for the door. Too late - ! . FREIGHT TRAIN PLOWS INTO THE RANGE ROVER! Coupling smashes through the window. Impales the car, CRUSHING Jon pushing the mangled wreck along the tracks...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Range Rover scraping along the wall in a tail of SPARKS. Smith dives out of the way. Car wreck and freight cars THUNDERING past him... .toward Martin and Gina, pelting full-speed... almost on them... last second, they DIVE into the alcove... through steel door into the utility access STAIRS. Gina doubled, gasping for breath... but they've got to ke going. Both staggering up the zig-zag iron steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumps up. Sprints after them. Through the steel door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith sprinting up to a landing. Another landing. Narrow tunnel. Booming ECHOES. Rush of AIR. Smith dashes around corner. Slows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . breathless. Station JAMMED with SOCCER FANS. The bars have let out. Faces painted. Singing, drinking, a swarmin party. A train just emptying, the mass crowding out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina, squeezed together between laughing faces drunken youth, singing, chanting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Both of them in this chaotic oasis. Almost peaceful. Gina struggling to catch her breath. Relief. Shock. Grief Anger. Martin, looking at her. He knows what she's feelin She meets his eyes a moment, glances back... .sees Smith, caught in the crowd, but pushing his way towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... They push their way forward through the crush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd dissipates into the night. Gina takes Martin's hands, pulls him along a street of neon club signs, lines youth waiting to get in. BEHIND THEM. Smith emerges from the station, tracks them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina hurries them past bars and clubs. They come to a doo crowded with youths, Middle-Eastern and Balkan. Gina pulls Martin to the front. Unfriendly eyes STARE dow Martin, the huge BOUNCER nods recognition to Gina.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Smith stops, takes in the many clubs, the various Bouncer guarding their doors. Looks down at his boring suit, nods defeat. Turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 'SHINE' NIGHT CLUB- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The club is barely-lit, punctuated by beams of moving lig constant music. The bar a glowing oasis. Gina leads Marti through. They pass down through old WWII bomb shelter construction, through curtains, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even darker, only small glowing lights, candles, neon tub casts shadows. Quiet almost, only the dull 'thud" of the bass reaches them. He puts a hand on her shoulder... she pushes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . and she LOSES IT. Flies at him, slapping clumsily. Like an enraged child. Martin grabbing her... holding her tigh Bodies pressed together... as her anger and fear and grie dissolve into sobbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His family is in Africa. The money will just stop coming... they'll never know why... . Martin calming her, stroking her head. Her hand finding his, gripping it tight, wanting the contact. Martin looki down at the face buried in his chest. Feeling versus memo Gina... Liz... Torn. A long beat. Her control returning. And her strength. She separates from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life. No response. Eyes locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .You never know, what you will do, until the time comes, right? Martin looks down, unsure. She stays on his face. Looking for... Her eyes shift:

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE SPACE
dialogues.text: A young Serbian MANAGER speaks with a female BARTENDER. B cool, young, tough. Gina makes eye contact, heads nod in recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here... Martin watches her go, speak with them through low light smoke. His gaze wander... into the strobing lights...

dialogues.speaker: SUDDEN CUT
dialogues.text: .all WHITE. It's snow, drifting down... settling on a small idyllic home. Picket fence. Lights glow inside... . Suddenly INSIDE. Liz sits on the edge of a bed, glass o red wine in her hands. Martin enters the frame, his cloth and hands covered in drywall dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready... ? Liz rubs dust off his face, leans in to kiss him...

dialogues.speaker: INT. SHINE NIGHT CLUB- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Martin's eyes flick open and the SOUND and LIGHT of the c come flooding back in...

dialogues.speaker: GINA. UNDRESSING
dialogues.text: Low, moving lights pass across her body, wifebeater undershirt and jeans. She unzips the jeans, pulls them do long legs, pulls off the wifebeater, no bra... . hesitates. Looks back, sees that Martin is watching her Beat. Beat. Lights catch glimpses of her body, her breast the arch of her back. She turns slightly away from him, pushes a pile of borrow clothing towards him. A heavy coat, some jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Put these on. She pulls a mod shirt on, glances back as he now undresse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you happy? He looks up, shirt in his hands. She doesn't waiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your marriage? Was it happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Yes. I think so... I don't remember... how it felt exactly. She approaches him, leans in so she can see his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why would she do this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .For the same reason I would. If I thought it was the only way to protect her. Gina nods, distant. Martin presses on, difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep having a dream. Liz is in the bedroom of our home, although it's different somehow. Her hair's different... she's smiling, about to say something. Then it ends. I can remember places, details...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't remember... how I felt. He stops. Just the low pulsing BEAT from the other room T lights revolving over them. Gina watching him. Looking back at her. That connection again. He looks away. She shakes it off, produces a borrowed joint, offers it t him. He shakes his head no. She shrugs, sparks it. Inhale deeply, eyes close. She leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need to get out of town. There's a man who's helping me. He can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seems to ignore him) In Bosnia... It was not like you probably imagine. It was nice. .there were cherry blossoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, I was sixteen. My sister and my brother came to me and said hey let's play hide and seek, down by the creek. He had ten Marka for whoever won. It was amazing, the way he just said it... Beat. She raises the joint, hits it again. Her eyes open, but she's deep in the memory and it's intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .So I went down to this place I knew, under the small bridge over the creek. And I hid and waited. Not really that long... Then I went back home, to find my brother and collect my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, and my father and my uncle were dead. And so was my mother. My sister was alive... for a little while. She turns her head, eyes blaze straight at Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not enough, to kill us. They wanted us to remember, every day, for the rest of our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Raped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No one touched me. But now... I'm not going anywhere. I'm not running anymore. She nestles in under his arm. Closes her eyes. He lets hi hand gently stroke her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let anything happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar... Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll protect you. She opens her eyes again, looks up at him, smiles, on her to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Cool.

dialogues.speaker: CHILL SPACE
dialogues.text: Gina sleeps, at peace. Martin leans over the one object h has left, his copy of "Horticus." He studies the number markings on the flap, working...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vast windowless cylindrical building on the city's edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheering CROWD; a sound like THUNDER. A massive indoor STADIUM, CYCLISTS racing on a reverberating wood track be a suspended lighting rig the size of a spaceship. MARTIN at the counter of a busy bar. Jeans, T-shirt, Bomb Jacket. Different look, to say the least. Across the bar, GINA nurses a coffee. They exchange looks, briefly. A familiar grey-skinned figure settles next to him: JURGEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. Martin glances around, edgy. Jurgen watches him, glances Gina long enough to let Martin know he's spotted her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the most dangerous man in the world is the man who feels that he is drowning. He will drag under anyone who tries to help him. Jurgen sets his newspaper on the bar. A picture and artic about the murdered nurse. Martin's picture, fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, bitter) I... I didn't do it. Jurgen studies him, hard. Looks back at Gina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had something. Martin feels in his pockets, takes out the copy of 'Horticus', turns to the numbers on the end papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These numbers, are a code. The first number refers to the page of a given book. The second to a specific line on that page. The third number to words on that line. If I didn't have the exact edition of the book, the code would be unbreakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, impressed) And what do the numbers refer to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where it breaks down -- the words are the Latin names of two plant species... Calochortus Albus... and Umbellularia Californica. Fairy Lantern... and California Bay. Both common flowering plants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not part of your work? Or Professor Bressler's? Martin shakes his head. Jurgen grunts. Pencils notes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your thesis. The one you sent Bressler. What was the title?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The role of Gorytini and Thynnidae in Drakea pollination."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it was after reading it that he invited you here. Correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct. Yes. Look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever know someone called Laurence Darnell? Martin looks at him quizzically. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a graduate student at the University of Wisconsin. He died in an auto accident earlier this year. He was doing research very similar to yours. Jurgen studying him closely. Martin shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is Professor Bressler's relationship with Prince Fahad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fahad's sponsoring the Forum, Bressler's the keynote speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they're not close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way... they're opposites. Bressler wants to end world hunger. Open research... universal access to all his data on crop cultivation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Fahad's just a businessman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both progressives. Fahad knows we'll need food long after oil. New agricultural patents are worth billions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his progressiveness has cost him... his own people hate him... the attempts on his life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got balls, that's for sure. Another beat. Jurgen slides the 'Uncle Sam' bookmark card from the pages of the 'Horticus'... turns it over, Martin remembered schedule scribbled on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cocktail party, before Bressler's speech tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in our suite. Champagne and hors d'oeuvres for Bressler and a few of his guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Fahad going to be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Bressler invited him... Martin trails off. Starting to get there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin Harris... with just a few guests, in a confined space with Prince Fahad. For some, that might be a very good reason to want to be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus... You can't -- Jurgen flips his notebook shut. Gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I need a few more hours. You need to go somewhere you will not be seen. Then meet me outside the Cafe Adler on the Kochstrasse. 6.30 sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina thread their way through streets teeming AFRICAN and MIDDLE EASTERN immigrants, music blasting fro storefronts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELECTRONICS STORE. In the window a muted TV flickers w the NEWS: A report on the hospital murder. Martin's image Gina glances around... a COP up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go. We have to do what Jurgen said, stay out of -- She starts to pull him away, but he's not moving. He's staring at the pre-paid cell phones on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen may have nothing. (beat, to her) I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz sits in front of the bedroom vanity in her bra and sk putting on makeup. The room's shower is on. CLOSE as she applies mascara. The Camera searches her fac her small gestures, looking for clues... Shower stops. IN DEEP FOCUS behind her, Martin B comes out of the bathr nude. He picks a robe up off the bed, pulls it on as he approaches her, places his hands on her shoulders. They stare at each other in the vanity mirror... RING! RI Martin B picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Harris speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, Dr. Harris. This is Else Adlam from Dr. Bressler's office. Dr. Bressler was wondering if you might be able to meet with him today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina, dressed in the modish cap and shades, on a new pre-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .No, I don't know, but he stressed it was important. Eleven o'clock, if that's all right? Weinhaus Huth on Tiergarten... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the phone. Across from her, Martin, a cap pull low over his features. He opens another phone, dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, this is Dr. Harris. I have a message for Dr. Bressler...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen hands over a library card. A LIBRARIAN finds his request slip, slides two documents across the counter. On a printed monograph; the other a photocopy in brads.

dialogues.speaker: A WHILE LATER
dialogues.text: He finishes reading the printed monograph. Closes it. Looking down at the cover... "The role of Gorytini and Thynnidae in Drakea pollination" by Martin Harris, PhD. He slides the bound photocopy next to it. "The process of Drakea pollination" by Laurence Darnell, University of Wisconsin. A long beat. The two titles side-by-side. Sudden thought... Jurgen takes something out of his pocke the card that was inside Martin's 'Horticus'. The scribbl schedule notations on one side... turns it over: the bowl alley's Uncle Sam logo. Jurgen holds closer, studying it. His mind clicking... . printed German text. A number: 21. And right at the bottom, a small time-clock stamp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina stand amidst a flow of tourists and local near the entrance to Berlin's equivalent of Central Park its zoo. Across, the Weinhaus Restaurant is a fin-de-siec style brasserie bordering the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .The zoo. She loves Polar Bears. I never knew exactly why. Gina nods, looks over to the restaurant. Looks back at Martin who hasn't moved. She checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, go. You're going to be late for your date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin nods, heads into the park. Long, curving paths bordered by green. A labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PARK'S ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Gina watches, sunglasses on, as a taxi pulls up and a wir haired man steps out, pays the driver. Lap-top bag over h shoulder. BRESSLER.

dialogues.speaker: FEW MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Another taxi arrives, Liz and Martin B get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shouldn't take long. I just need to see what Bressler wants. Liz's gaze settles on the painted sign for the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time, I want to see the zoo anyway. ON LIZ. Memory, or nostalgia, touch her cool face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the Polar Bears... Martin B nods, watches her go. He checks his watch and he inside.

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSITE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: GINA, doing her best to casually window-shop at a designe storefront. Stolen glance across the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER offers to take Bressler's lap-top bag. Bressle politely declines him... The waiter nods, leaves. Bressler opens the computer bag, checks on the lap-top inside. Zips it back up. Positions the bag by his elbow. Smiles to Martin B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we might have a table for three, in case you still had your alter ego with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank God. I assume he's safely back in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a lesson. You never know what people will do. All my work used to be on-line, my e- mails on an open server. A year ago, someone broke into my office and stole my computer. I believe they were after my research. Luckily, I split my data up and double encrypt it until I put it all together and make it public. That's why this stays with me until tonight's over... Martin B nods, starts to look at his menu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what was so important that it could not wait until this evening? ON MARTIN B, REALIZING he's been played. A single BLINK. beat. When he looks up, he's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you can forgive me. It was something you said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .It's been tormenting me. UNDER THE TABLE. Martin B has his phone out and is TEXTIN blind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMITH sits on a bench near a pond, tossing bread crumbs t ducks. His phone chirps, he checks it and is MOVING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina ducks into a store doorway. Takes out her cell phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . the other cell phone in MARTIN'S hand. He answers it...

dialogues.speaker: GINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: They just sat down. Martin's gaze doesn't waiver. Up ahead of him, glimpsed through the crowds... Liz. He follows, watching, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLATTER of falling pins... 'Uncle Sam' logo. Juke box Elv serenading desultory daytime bowlers. Jurgen hands the TICKET from Martin's book to a bored ATTENDANT. She goes away... returns a moment later with a purple bow TOTE BAG. Plonks it on the counter. Rips off a ticket counterfoil - '21'. Checks the time-stamp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August. Three months. That'll be twenty-five Euros. A beat. Jurgen pays her, picks up the bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents buying tickets... excited kids push through the turnstiles under the gilded elephants of the entrance. Liz buys a ticket. Passes beneath the elephant gate. Martin starts to move forward... then DOUBLES BACK as Smi arrives, hurrying, again checking his phone. He pushes to the front of the line, pays his way in, eyes searching. Martin moves out behind him, hat pulled low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watchful staff; soothing music. Gina at a rack of dresses anxiously looks out of the window, staring at Martin B an Bressler in the restaurant, a silent heated exchange...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bressler in high form, reacting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! God NO! You're focusing on the science, but this... (patting his laptop) .this is history. You open the research before it's finished, the conglomerates gobble it up. In the entire history of human development, name me one time when business has ever acted except in its own self-interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin B catches a waiter's eye, signals for the check. Bressler catches this, looks to Martin B, questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's my fault. Another appointment I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. (jumping back in) But see you, you say I am too cautious. It's an idiot thing to say. I'm a realist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz wanders past some flamingos, checks a sign, heads in another direction. Behind her, Martin keeps his distance, keeps his eyes on Smith who's shadowing Liz, one path over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin B standing. Bressler, collecting his bag and scarf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I offended you, Dr. Bressler. I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. You can't offend me. We are colleagues, this is good discussion. But please, Dr. Harris -- Power is an animal, all to itself. It adapts, mutates to whatever form will best preserve it. It's always closer than we know. ON MARTIN B, extending a hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Perhaps you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina, crossing the street, searching the restaurant windo the table empty, busboy gathering up plates. P.O.V. urgen searching. Finds... . Bressler outside the restaurant getting into a taxi. He's alone. No sign of Martin B. Pulls out her phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, following the winding path lower as it descends. The sound of a cell-phone RING. Liz glances back... .Martin, pressed out of sight against a wall. He SILENCES his phone, tucks it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin B striding through the park toward the zoo... Gina way behind, trying to catch up. Dials again, Martin's phone going straight to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ PAUSED AT A GLASS WALL
dialogues.text: Her slim shoulders; her hair tucked into a scarf against rain, silhouetted in front of an underwater view. The gia Polar Bear swims, inches in front of her. LIZ'S FACE. Her eyes, soft. A smile... which fades as she senses a presence. Turns. FACES us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing across from her in this protected space. A stran numbness. Doesn't know where to start...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Liz. Just that syllable. She stares back, features tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz. What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy -- you have to leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why --?: I have to know why, Liz. Are they making you do this? Are they threatening you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .How did you find me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The zoo. The Polar Bears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? I KNOW YOU, Liz. You KNOW me... Liz's eyes fixed on his. She searches his face. A long beat. Her facade seems suddenly to crumble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . can't get out. Can't leave. They'll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith's path has veered him away from Liz's. Frustrated, he's a little lost. His eyes play over the entrance to th lower area, other women, also with umbrellas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin B waiting in the ticket line at the gates... Gina approaches, breathless. Sees Martin B. Hangs back from the ticket line. Spots a large party of school kids. Gina steps past the line, confidently joins the group... another parent. Swept through the turnstiles. Behind her, Martin B steps up to the ticket window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they making you do? Is it about Fahad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me, right now. We can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! They'll kill us both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they? She shakes her head, tormented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Not now. Not until we're safe. Then I'll explain everything, I promise. All I want is for us to get out alive. You have to believe me... Urgent look around. Her eyes lock on his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My case...? She closes on him. A wave of emotion as she's almost in h arms, her hands on his face, searching his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your briefcase. It got left behind. At the airport. That's why you were going back there. You need to find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an hour, there's a chance for me to get away. Meet me at the airport at three o'clock. We can run together... Martin's eyes. Mind racing. Eyes suddenly catching GINA, walking right by. Moment's urgent eye contact. The signal Martin B's here. He's on his way... What can he do? He knows he can't stay. Suddenly, Liz mov her face to his. Kisses him on the lips. Whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. A beat. Martin steps back slowly. Their eyes hold. Then h turns, walks quickly away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the glass of the penguin exhibit. She saw the kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuts up a small path rising up from the Polar Bear area. the top he turns, hiding himself, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Smith and Martin B converge from opposite directions on L speak at her, close, heated. Smith pops open his phone. Martin B GLARES at Liz, almost pushing her back against t glass. She GLARES back up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Nothing he can do now. He turns away, moves to the top o the path where Gina waits for him. They walk in silence..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty... Martin doesn't acknowledge. Each face a mix of emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light rain. JURGEN crosses the street to his building, carrying the bowling bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone on his desk starts RINGING. No one to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina hurry across the street. Cellphone to Martin's ear. Listening to it RING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen lumbers asthmatically up the stairs. Gets to the fourth floor. Sound of the PHONE RINGING above. Trudges u the last flight... .Phone STOPS RINGING just as Jurgen reaches the top. He stops, wheezing. An ENVELOPE propped against the door. He picks it up. Thumbs it open. Takes out: DETAIL SHOT -- TWO PRINT-OUT SCANS... from the security camera at airport Immigration. A couple at a desk. Liz and Martin. Unmistakably Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hears the phone START RINGING again inside his apartment. Fumbles in his pocket for the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen grabs the phone. Puffing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ja ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Ernst Jurgen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: My name's Rodney Cole. You left a message on my phone. There were two from Martin as well. What kind of trouble is he in?

dialogues.speaker: INT. LEHRTER BAHNHOF TRAIN STATION, BERLIN DAY
dialogues.text: Trains rumble and whoosh. Booming ANNOUNCEMENTS. Hurried commuters pushing past... . RODNEY COLE -- he's the academic colleague we've seen i Martin's memory flashes -- an avuncular man about ten yea Martin's senior. Talks on a cell phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... that's unbelievable, the poor man. Well here's the good news -- I've just arrived in Berlin... yes, I've been teaching in Leipzig, at the Hochschule fur Technik. I came up for the last day to hear Bressler's speech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come right over, it's not far... No, it's no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it, Herr Cole... Puts the phone down. A beat. Another look at the airport scans of Martin. Studying them a moment. Jurgen opens the bowling bag, up-ends it onto the table. Bowling shoes, a shirt, a hand towel... Taking a knife from the counter, Jurgen cuts around the bottom of the bag... lifts away a false floor. Reaches inside. The contents hidden from us... a shadow of tensio crosses his face. Then a slow, enigmatic smile.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: . the mournful HOWL of its whistle. Jurgen turns off the gas. Spoons Nescafe into a mug. Opens a closet, reaches over a musty clutter of jars and boxes... finds a rusted sugar tin. Inside is a single ancient sachet of sweetener. A beat, pensive. He tears it open, adds it to the Nescafe. He looks up. Listening for... anticipating... . the lively KNOCK at his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jurgen opens the door... it's RODNEY COLE, grinning... shaking rain from his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herr Jurgen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Cole... Please, come on in. Jurgen ushers him in. Leads them into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink? I've a bottle labelled 'brandy', which is more than likely hair lacquer... or some vodka my neighbor gave me after it made her husband go blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some coffee? I'm making some for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. Thanks. Cole looks around the tiny apartment. Sees the framed pho on the mantel. Looks closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the military?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stasi. In East Germany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, wait till I tell my son. He loves all that Cold War stuff. Look at that car. What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 'Zil'. Suspension of a donkey cart and smelt like a tannery. Vanished as quickly as the Wall. Cole studies the other pictures. Notices Martin's Rolex beside them. Jurgen pours the kettle into his mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. This business with Martin. A hell of a thing. How did he find you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite by chance, as it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like he was damn lucky. So, what can I do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us to the authorities. Help them confirm his identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The authorities? Jesus, it's that bad? A guy comes to you with a story like that. What made you take the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiosity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiosity? Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professional curiosity. There's not much in this world left to interest an old spy like me... Cole's face tightens... his back still toward Jurgen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . a few questions I still think over. One in particular. From when I worked for the Aufklarung: our foreign intelligence wing. Cole still hasn't moved. Discreetly slips open a button o his jacket. Jurgen cradles his coffee, steam rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this rumor. Of a US based assassination unit called Section 15. Freelance, deniable. They'd work for whoever would pay -- public sector, private sector. Second-to-none in their planning and efficiency. They never failed. What's more, they were invisible. They'd strike, and nobody would even know there had been foul play. It was only rumor, of course... Cole turning to face Jurgen. Smile gone. Glint of a gun inside his packet. Jurgen looking steadily back at him. Takes a deep gulp of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had fifteen minutes after I called. Why didn't you run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I run from Section 15, Mr. Cole? I can hardly walk. The edge of a smile, another large gulp of the coffee. Jurgen sets down the cup. He wheezes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I could get Chesterfields, I smoked sixty machorkas a day. Filthy Soviet things. Killed more Russians than Stalin. My doctors assure me I'll soon be joining their list of casualties. Cole looking back at him, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know how he found you. I want every number, every source you've contacted on his behalf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what? We shake hands and you go away? Cole reaches a hand inside his jacket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need for that. Beat. Cole's eyes flicker. Jurgen's body tightening... th coffee... the empty sachet of sweetener...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole looks at Jurgen. A moment's glimmer of respect. He doesn't move. His gaze lingering. Understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never think... you'll have the courage to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we do. The best of us. Jurgen coughs again. Suddenly sways. Puts a hand out to steady himself. Knocking over the mug of coffee... as the cyanide sweeps through him. Trembling hands clasp the edge of table. Building force. Shaking. His piercing eyes never leaving Cole... through the pain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... if he remembers everything. What then...? No answer. Jurgen's hands slip. He slumps forward, his he hammering down onto the table. A final convulsion. Then he's still. A long beat. Cole buttons his jacket. Slips on some glove Gently lifts Jurgen's head from the table top, rests it o forearm, as though Jurgen were asleep rather than dead. Restoring some dignity to him. Cole goes to the mantel, wipes off the one framed photo h picked up. Takes Martin's Rolex, drops it into his pocket He turns, casting an expert eye over the apartment... The legs of the stove... ever so slightly askew... The phone RINGS... RINGS... Cole ignores it, moves forwar

dialogues.speaker: I./E. "JET EXPRESS" BUS/AUTOBAHN
dialogues.text: Martin hits re-dial on his cell. Listens, frustrated. The phone RINGING and RINGING. He flips it shut. Gina's eyes meet his. A long beat. She looks back out the window. Sleeting rain streaks the glass. Endless grey city-scape. He tracks a clock: 1:40. Looks back at Gina who senses hi gaze, keeps hers straight out.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: He finds a section of loose KICK-BOARD. Carefully pries i away. Reaches into the hole: The PHOTOGRAPH of Martin and Liz, arriving. And Jurgen's NOTEBOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns up the gas, feeds the photograph to the flames. he watches it burn, he leafs carefully through the notebo

dialogues.speaker: I/E ARRIVALS TERMINAL, TEGEL AIRPORT
dialogues.text: Cathedral-like, overcrowded. Inaudible PAs. Carts loaded with luggage. Watchful POLICE and SECURITY. Martin and Gina, heads down under caps, navigate a surge passengers rushing out of the doors, clutching bags, competing for taxis in the pouring rain... Martin stops. Deja-vu overload. His fractured memories. Past and present merging. The FACES. The SOUNDS... An AIRPORT SECURITY Man glances over, concerned. Gina tra the attention, moves into Martin, fake-romantic, her face close to his...

dialogues.speaker: GINA
dialogues.text: Martin. C'mon... Gina touching his face. Bringing him back. He glances to clock on the wall: 2:10...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin and Gina wait at a counter. Clock reads 2:25. A WOMAN returns with a leather briefcase. A name tag on the handle. 'Dr. M.A. Harris'. Martin stares at it... reachin for memories. The woman checks her computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see some identification? She looks up. Martin's expression distant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have any. He was in an accident, that's why the bag was unclaimed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combination. For the lock. It's 2... 8... 0... 6... A beat. The woman and Gina both looking at Martin. The woman enters the numbers. The locks pop open. She lifts t lid, picks something up. A pause... then her expression softens. She turns it toward Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with personal effects. Sitting on top a US passpor A long beat. Martin's hands unsteady as he opens it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His photo. And his name... Doctor Martin Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noisy and busy. Gina uneasy... watching Martin as he carefully examines each item in the case. Everything familiar, yet strange. His, but somehow not his. a copy of 'Scientific American' magazine, a comb, some gum, a Newark Airport parking ticket. His published paper the same edition Jurgen found at the library. his leather wallet. Martin studies it. Identical to the one Martin B had. Opens it...

dialogues.speaker: THE WALLET
dialogues.text: New Hampshire Driver's license. Credit cards. Martin fumbles inside a pocket, pulls out... . the EXACT SAME PHOTO we saw in Bressler's lab of a younger Liz with a younger Martin B in Paris. Except this time it's a younger Martin beside Liz-in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gazing at it. He runs his fingers over its dock-eared corners, every bump and crease. Looks up to find Gina watching him. A long, awkward pause. She reaches over. Takes the photo from him. Studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you remember now... how you felt? Martin's silence hangs in the noise and activity around t Gina handing back the photo. He stares down at Liz again Gina stands, start to collect her things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't stay here, it's not safe for you... Her voice trails off as she looks at Martin, really sees in this moment. He looks up at her, torn, back down at th pictures, the relics of his life, his memories, spread ou front of him. He glances at the clock: 2:55... Gina tracks his gaze... gets it, takes a step back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I'm an idiot. She's meeting you here. Martin meets her gaze, open book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Yes. I'm sorry. Yes. She's my wife. She's in danger. I have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, auto-pilot) That's good. I'm happy for you. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait. I meant what I said. We can take care of you. I can get you money, arrange --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Be quiet. You've got what you wanted. You don't need me anymore and in case "we've" forgotten, I take care of myself very well. She starts for the door. Martin getting up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina stops, turns. A beat. Sadness, anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One kiss and suddenly... Everything that's happened? To Biko? To us? -- I know, she's your wife. Like I said, I'm an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Martin. She turns away again. Martin, frozen, watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina keeps walking. Pouring rain... ROAR of traffic. No look back. She joins the line waiting for taxis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin still sitting there. The photo of him and Liz in Paris. Sudden decision, snaps the briefcase shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina almost at the head of the taxi line. A glance back. People... vehicles... no sign of Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin out of the doors. Eyes frantically searching for Gina. In the distance... he sees her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina at the front of the line. A taxi pulls up. She steal a last look back at the terminal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lady. You ready...? Gina's face suddenly lighting up... she can see Martin! Spins back to the TAXI DRIVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. There's another passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin weaving quickly through the crowds toward her... B PAST a man who looks back, his face lighting up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin...? Martin hesitates, turns. Sees... RODNEY COLE. Beaming smile. Martin stares at him, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Martin, how are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodney? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me, remember? You left a message on my machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but how did you know --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole suddenly right up close. Presses a rolled newspaper into Martin's side. Cold steel of a concealed Qun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay one step ahead of me. Any move, I'll shatter your spine. His voice flat with menace. Martin's mouth opening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Go... Martin glancing round. Cole jerks him back, guiding him toward the passenger pick-up zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina looking back around. Bemused. Martin vanished again the crowd. Then a sudden stab of alarm...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN... MOVING FAST
dialogues.text: A man she doesn't know carrying his case... headed toward parked commercial van. Driver waiting for them. She recognizes him... SMITH. Martin hustled into the back... door shuts. Engine starts. A VOICE snaps us... . BACK TO SCENE -- THE TAXI DRIVER... standing in front of Gina -- losing patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss. I ain't got all day. Mind racing. Beat. Points to a suitcase a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with my bags, please. The driver goes to fetch the case. Is stopped by its OWNE Raised voices. Moment's confusion. Then... .the SQUEAL of TIRES. The taxi driver spins around to see Gina gone and his own taxi pulling away. He YELLS after h furious. But she's off in traffic...

dialogues.speaker: I/E. VAN/BERLIN CITY MOTORWAY
dialogues.text: Smith drives. Deadly silence. Martin motionless. Cole opposite him with the gun, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interior goes dim as Smith takes a hard right, into an ABANDONED PARKING STRUCTURE, taking a ramp, spiraling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dart between Cole and Smith. Heart racing. Struggling to make sense of things. Cole studying him in quiet amazemen Shakes his head. Thinking out loud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... she's right. You're completely gone. You really think you are Martin Harris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell Rod! You're my oldest friend! You know who I am. It's me... it's not that other guy. He's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Martin Harris? You're right. He's not. He's the guy who took over for you after you went missing. Exasperated, Cole leans forward. Spelling it out.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
